Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: paco55brooklyn
Reviews.Content: on dec 2011 we stay in el faro hotel the 4 day we stay was very guiet and very nice i recomendend this hotel in aguadilla

Reviews.Title: “El Faro Parador, not the Suites”
Reviews.Author: DumplingOmega
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few years ago. It was clean, and the staff was friendly. There is a pleasant rustic feeling to the room design,terracotta tile floors, etc. The hotel structure is welcoming for a family with kids or for any group, as it is low rise, and the rooms all lead to the courtyard which has a decent restaurant, and a pool. There is an excellent beach nearby -- As I recall it was crashboat beach? WHatever the case, this beach was one of the nicest in all of Puerto Rico, and there is a shuttle from the hotel to the beach if you don't want to drive. I never tried the pool and don't remember if it was clean; why would you use a pool when you have beaches? From Aguadilla, it was a short trip to the caves, or Rincon, or Cabo Rojo. If you want to see San Juan, you can drive there, but it is a hike, and the Rain Forest, El Junque, is so out of the way that we did not attempt it. The only problem with this hotel is finding it in the first place, as it is very poorly marked. We had to ask the locals to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “This was a HORRIBLE hotel experience, I would have rather stayed at an hour by hour hotel rental!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sio1luv
Reviews.Content: DO NOT EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL. THIS HAS BEEN THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! (El Faro Hotel in Aguadilla, P.R.) No hot water all 4 days, even after changing ALL of our rooms. And then on the last day in the new room I was locked in!!! The FREAKN door lock broke! My brother had to kick the damn door in. Un FREAKN real I tell you!!!! And by the way the phone had no dial tone!!! Oh and as for the window there was no way i was going to fit through! If this had been a true emergency like a fire or heart attack we, meaning my 15yr. daughter and 14yr. niece would have no made it out alive.

Reviews.Title: “strategy placed”
Reviews.Author: Sharili
Reviews.Content: Good service and very clean. Perfect for a peaceful trip or trip with friends. If your looking for a cheap option this is it. Game room, breakfasts, activity room, two pools, kids area. Placed near touristic places, beaches, ice skating, waterparks, etc.!

Reviews.Title: “better than the options”
Reviews.Author: ronbonbfhon
Reviews.Content: This review is for the hotel by the airport. It is directly behind the Marriot. I paid $75 bucks a night, the room was okay, everything rather dated but clean and functional. Coffee maker, basic amenities provided, spacious room and bath. The tiki bar is nice and the food there was pretty good. This hotel is basically two old buildings which used to be officers quarters at an old air force base. A/c worked fine. I will probably stay here again because the option is to pay $125 per night at the Marriot. There are no other places to stay nearby except La Cima, which had poor reviews (I did not visit there).

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcasiano
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience, since check-in, room condition, people drinking and talking loud all over the place, children running and knocking doors, "mosquitos" all over the room very dangerous if you never been in the Caribbean. We stay there for one hour, I request a refund at front desk and went to Holiday Inn, half hour from there at Mayaguez.

Reviews.Title: “El Faro Parador and El Faro Suites (2 different places)”
Reviews.Author: Lillian441
Reviews.Content: There is El Faro Suites by the Aguadilla Airport and there is El Faro Parador by the main road about 15 minutes from the suites one. In the rest of my review I will refer to them as the suites and the parador The suites is simply horrible, the parador is lovely. We were suppose to stay at the suites for 3 nights and stayed 1 night (because there was nothing else available). We moved to the parador for the other 2 nights. The rooms at the suites are old and the worst part is that it is dirty and musty.we did not even check the rest of the facilities. We were showed 2 different rooms and they both were simply awful. The parador has an open and airy lobby that is rustic and welcoming. Some of the rooms have not been renovated but they are clean and in much better condition than the suites. They have a newer bldg were the rooms have been renovated and are lovely. It is located in a more convenient area with access to restaurant, hospital, church, beach and not far from the mall and other attractions. The staff was very helpful an accommodating and they all speak english very well. I hope this review is helpful and informative. Not sure how anyone could give the El Faro Suites a good review.

Reviews.Title: “Clean... Comfortable... Friendly Staff... and Tow Pools!”
Reviews.Author: JanetteCarrasquillo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with a group of co-workers during a weekend. We found the staff very friendly. Very clean room and bathroom. Rustic wood furniture at the lobby and room too, so beautiful. And the beds are comfortable. I found that the coffee maker's canter was missing. I went to the front desk, and in less than 15 mins I had a new one. They play yard, basketball court, and plenty of green areas. And they have two pools! Small pool is coooold, big pool is warmer. I did not try their restaurant's food, but I guess it should be good, because the restaurant was full. Really I can not say anything bad about the hotel or the staff. In my opinion, they deserve the Five!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: prpeanut7
Reviews.Content: staff was friendly, they offered discounts on other hotels in different towns, $ good. pool needed cleaning, stayed 1 night no fridge, no micro, kind og islated in the back near pool. you kind of feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel good location will go back”
Reviews.Author: Marie432152
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and night crew was very courteous.Hotel room was simple but nice overall clean hotel. Renovations was taking place when we stayed there and it was looking really nice. I will definitely stay there again is close to highway,Crash Boat beach,Mall,Airport and more.

Reviews.Title: “Not nice at all”
Reviews.Author: lalyIsabela
Reviews.Content: Not a very warm welcome, bathroom made me feel like I was staying at a hospital, not a comfortable bed at all, too noisy, no privacy at all, not a very clean room, felt like leaving, checked out as soon as I could. No iron, we asked for one and it never came to our room. No blower, absolutely will never stay again and we do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for retreats, conferences, or short term stays.”
Reviews.Author: enatal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a marriage retreat, Hotel was already chosen for us. Hotel is plain and simple lodging, no luxuries. Rooms have air conditioning. Some rooms had only cold water. Other rooms had no irons. Hotel rooms do not have hair dryers, but has a beauty salon/spa on site. Cable TV lineup is very limited. Wireless free Internet access is only available in common areas. Grounds are well maintained. Rooms are generally clean. Staff service is prompt and acceptable. Meals we ate was from hotel restaurant, were served cool, and tasted like warmed-up frozen food. Swimming pools (2 large pools) looked nice and inviting, well maintained. Meeting room air conditioning was well set. Recommend only for conferences, retreats and stop-overs. For beach access, you may need to use a car to go to the Crash Boat Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Noisy All The Night Long”
Reviews.Author: e-cruise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Faro for four miserable nights. It is a very noisy hotel. We didn't didn't sleep at all for the nights that we were there. The hotel itself is very dirty, the towels weren't the greatest either. The price is cheap but the old saying goes you get what you pay for. A great lesson learned. I would not reccomend this hotel to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: sky_empress
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the Faro hotel in Aguadilla, throughtout the 24 hours we were there, we noticed several things that is of concern to us...most of them safety/security related. First, one door to the room did not close completely and only one of the safety latches worked. All three room had doors that did not reach the floor and had large gaps allowing bugs to get in. The two fire detectors in my room had no batteries inside. The others did not check but we suspect they didn't work either. There was no security at all present on premises--only one front desk clerk, two restaurant staff and a few housekeeping staff. With the hotel being set in a wide open outdoor spaces (and heavily wooded areas) and it opening up to random run down shacks, the hotel was not safe. At night, the courtyard areas where one walks back and forth from the front desk and pool/restaurant area to our rooms had little to no lighting--making the whole area dark and susceptible to safety issues. The block of the building we were placed in were in the back corner of the hotel and our doors out of view of any hotel staff or security if there was any (and walking up to the building again was dark and not lit). Aside from those security problems we saw, the rooms themselves were just dirty. The tiles had lots of grime and most specifically mold on them and the bathroom looked like gas station bathrooms with cracks and tiles broken off. At night, there were roach activity as well. The furniture was made of unpolished wood and had many splinters and any metal furniture rusted. The WiFi was non-existent and everyone had issues logging on, and it just didn't work. The staff was indifferent and once it got dark, we felt unsafe to venture out of our rooms so we just stayed in. It felt like we were locked down. No where else have I experience a crew property this dismal and unsafe. It was near the beach. In addition, the previous review about one towel per room is pretty much true. They do shampoo and soap in truck stop style dispensers mounted on the wall. The sheets being thread-bare was true too. I itched the whole night sleeping there. The pool was clean and had no odor while I was there. The microwave and min-fridge was a nice addition but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless you have a very tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Tranquilidad
Reviews.Content: We found the place to be totally relaxing, the pool was clean, the towels..well they could give more. The 3 amigo bar/grill food was excellent very very reasonable. attentivness of the staff was excellent. They could use..some additions of play area for those guest that have children. The bar was closed at 1130 when we arrived there back from a day trip, no noise...quite..and clean. for the Price one could not ask for more.Now if one is Donald Trump, well then go stay at the caribe Hilton. But considering it all, the place was EXCELLENT Ramos from New Jersey..and we will defintely recommend the place...to others

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Stitch28
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a stay at El Faro from July 2008 - August 2008. The rooms were ok. The furniture was pretty old and had stains on them. The bed covers were stained and needed to be replaced. The bathroom in my room was kind of run down. The toilet did not flush correctly. The first day we were there the pool was completely green and had a certain odor to it. In our group of people we had 5 children with us. I do not think this is a kid friendly hotel. They have huge parties on Tuesdays and Thursdays every week. Their bar and restaurant is open to the public. There were so many people there that we did not have any parking space available to us. The party lasted until about 4:00 am. There were people standing next to our room window talking loudly and yelling. There were 5 people staying in our room and we were given (1) towel. I had to repeatedly go down to the office and ask for more towels. The restaurant at the hotel was ok but the service was extremely slow and they were a bit pricey. After 5 days we decided to check out and stay at the Marriott Hotel right across the street from El Faro. I do not think I would recommend this hotel to anyone with children.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable, Amazing. My stay during 3 of july to 6 of july2008”
Reviews.Author: leimarpr
Reviews.Content: During my Stay i feel very good . The inn is very excellent to Family and Couple, the attention of the personnel is very good like the food is excellent and they have reasonable price. The Recreational Areas and the pool is very good. The Activity in the Nigth thety have Kareokee and DJ. The PiÃ±a Colada is veryyyy Gooodddddd.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luiggi_98
Reviews.Content: Went for a wedding and also to relax with the country view. The first night the room smell horrible and had many mosquitoes inside the room. We were a party of five that booked 3 rooms. Upon returning from the wedding my parents in law founded in a plastic bag their belongings. Supposedly, they didnt reserved the second day. The hotel staff were laughing while my mother in law was crying. Manager appear and pretended to resolve the situation by giving an upgrade to the Faro Suites. Unfortunely, the upgrade did not mitigate our terrible experience. Finally, to make things worst, got bronchitis from the horrible smell. Not even the low fare, makes appealing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: kln62
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Faro, because we were attending a wedding, in Aguadilla. We had a nice, clean room, with great AC...The room was above the pool, so it was a little noisy at times, but if you closed the bathroom door it was very tolerable. The POOL IS THE BEST! Enjoyed it very much, the bar is fantastic, but the breakfast left a little to be desired. We had a great weekend, the staff was very accomadating. Would definitly reccomend the hotel, and will stay there agian, when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: emelinammr
Reviews.Content: El Faro Suite Hotel in Aguadilla, Puerto Rico. We stayed with a tour group on January 19 and checked out on January 22. Although we were told it was a year old hotel, Formely Ramey Base, it was not so new. They painted the old barracks of the military base, but did not remodel anything else. The towels in all the rooms were worn out with the seams all flaky, some had holes on them. They did not have wash cloths either. A friend was told the bathrooms had hair blowers, but we could not find one bathroom with a hair blower or an electric outlet! The only electric outlet in the room was on top of the picture above the night stand, too high for me to reach. We needed to play with the faucet in the shower to get hot water, one of the guests did not have hot water at all and his TV was not working. The first night the restaurant was closed to the public because of a meeting/rally of a politician (I believe Fortuno) and the fight of Tito Trinidad. The next morning the restaurant was closed until 10:30 because the cook who was the only one with a key stayed too late due to the fight the night before. The next day although breakfast was included in our package, we only received a very cold treatment from a waitress because the cook was not there. She told us we had a choice of coffee or juice, not both, and toast and fruits. When I asked what fruits she answered "Peaches" from a can. The coffee was cold and we were not offered a second cup. The next day, the tour guide took us to eat breakfast somewhere else and requested a refund on the pre paid breakfasts. I don't know if they refund them the money. I do not recomend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: anita20152
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant was great. My niece had just given birth to her first child, and they allowed to me use their office computer to see the pictures that were e-mailed to me. The room was clean, and although we had rented the room with a refrigator, when we entered the room there was not one there. Within five minutes calling the front office about this, we were brought the fridge. Am planning to stay again in July. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A little Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great, accomodating, clean room and pool....perfect

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the things that I most liked was the free wireless internet access. I am just waiting for the opening of the new suites in Ramey.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MEG90046
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this hotel. I am originally from Aguadilla and had heard good things about El Faro. Since my flight was coming in very late, my sister and I decided to get a hotel room and rest before continuing on our vacation the following day. I was not able to book a room on line, so I called the hotel and asked if they had anything available. They said absolutely they had a double room available for a rate of $80. Although I thought the price was a little high for a hotel in Aguadilla I was confident that I would be getting a good room (the pictures on the web were very nice) where I woud feel safe and get a good nights rest. When I got there the reception gave me my key and said the room was down and to the right. We grabbed our bags and started walking, we searched all throughout the two wings of the hotel but could not find our room. When we went back to ask, we were told that our room was in a tiny building about 100 yards from the main hotel in the corner of the property. We get to the room and the air condinitoning was completely turned off, there was mold on the ceiling and it looked old and worn down. I immediately called the front desk to ask that they switch our room, but they said they were completely booked. Needless to say, I got sick from my allergy to the mold, and did not sleep very well since I did not feel very safe. The next morning I complained again, and the only explanation given was that they were very busy. I understand that hotels get booked up, but my problem is that I was given a very different impression of what I would be getting and was never told that I was getting a room in the corner of the property that was second rate. I plan on going to Aguadilla again in the near future, but I will never stay in that hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: IHP Hotel El Faro
HotelInfo.Address: 107 Street Km 2.1 Box 5148, Aguadilla 00603, Puerto Rico
